article.headline: Vermont 90, UMBC 62
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Four McGlynn scored 15 points, leading six Vermont players in double figures, and Brian Voelkel had 10 assists in a 90-62 victory over Maryland-Baltimore County on Sunday. Reflecting Vermont's scoring balance, seven players scored for the Catamounts (13-10, 7-2 America East Conference) during a 16-0 run midway through the first half that opened a 28-12 lead. Vermont led 39-23 after shooting 51.6 percent (16 of 31) in the first half, and the Catamounts bettered that in the final 20 minutes, making 63.0 percent (17 of 27), including 6 of 8 on 3-pointers. The Retrievers (3-16, 2-5) got no closer than 10 points in the second half, and Vermont ran off the next eight points to make it 59-41. Clancy Rugg scored 13 points for Vermont, which got 12 points each from Luke Apfeld, Matt Glass and Pat Bergmann, and 11 from Brendan Bald. Chase Plummer's 20 points led UMBC.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
